chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
E2: R -> Prop
E1: R -> Prop

Goal:
(forall x : R, E1 x <-> E2 x) -> Glb_Rbar E1 = Glb_Rbar E2

Premises:
*** [ R : Set ]
Glb_Rbar = fun E : R -> Prop => proj1_sig (ex_glb_Rbar E) : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]
Lub_Rbar_eqset : forall E1 E2 : R -> Prop, (forall x : R, E1 x <-> E2 x) -> Lub_Rbar E1 = Lub_Rbar E2
is_lub_Rbar_eqset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x <-> E1 x) -> is_lub_Rbar E1 l -> is_lub_Rbar E2 l
is_glb_Rbar_eqset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x <-> E1 x) -> is_glb_Rbar E1 l -> is_glb_Rbar E2 l
is_lb_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_lb_Rbar E1 l -> is_lb_Rbar E2 l
is_ub_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_ub_Rbar E1 l -> is_ub_Rbar E2 l
is_glb_Rbar_unique : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_glb_Rbar E l -> Glb_Rbar E = l
Tauto.eval_f_morph : forall (ex : ?TX -> Prop) (ev ev' : ?TA -> Prop) (f : Tauto.GFormula), (forall a : ?TA, ev a <-> ev' a) -> Tauto.eval_f ex ev f < -> Tauto.eval_f ex ev' f where ?TA : [E1 : R -> Prop E2 : R -> Prop |- Type] ?TX : [E1 : R -> Prop E2 : R -> Prop |- Type] ?AA : [E1 : R -> Prop E2 : R -> Prop |- Type] ?AF : [E1 : R -> Prop E2 : R -> Prop |- Type]
Tauto.GFormula_ind : forall P : Tauto.GFormula -> Prop, P Tauto.TT -> P Tauto.FF -> (forall t : ?TX, P (Tauto.X t)) -> (forall (t : ?TA) (a : ?AA), P (Tauto.A t a)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.Cj g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.D g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> P (Tauto.N g)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall (o : option ?AF) (g0 : Tauto.GFormula), P g0 -> P (Tauto.I g o g0)) -> forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g where ?TA : [E1 : R ->...-> Prop |- Type]
PropExtensionalityFacts.PropExt_and_PropFunExt_iff_PredExt : (forall A B : Prop, A <-> B -> A = B) /\ (forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x = Q x) -> P = Q) < -> (forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x <-> Q x) -> P = Q)
PropExtensionalityFacts.PropExt_and_PropFunExt_imp_PredExt : (forall A B : Prop, A <-> B -> A = B) -> (forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x = Q x) -> P = Q) -> forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x <-> Q x) -> P = Q
PropExtensionalityFacts.PredExt_imp_PropFunExt : (forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x <-> Q x) -> P = Q) -> forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x = Q x) -> P = Q
PropExtensionalityFacts.PredExt_imp_PropExt : (forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x <-> Q x) -> P = Q) -> forall A B : Prop, A < -> B -> A = B
VectorDef.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> Type, P 0%nat (VectorDef.nil ?A) (VectorDef.nil ?B) -> (forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 -> forall (a : ?A) (b : ?B), P (S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a n v1) (VectorDef.cons ?B b n v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 where ?A : [E1 : R -> Prop E2 : R -> Prop |- Type] ?B : [E1 : R -> Prop E2 : R -> Prop |- Type]
Build_Metric_Space : forall (Base : Type) (dist : Base -> Base -> R), (forall x y : Base, dist x y >= 0) -> (forall x y : Base, dist x y = dist y x) -> (forall x y : Base, dist x y = 0 <-> x = y) -> (forall x y z : Base, dist x y <= dist x z + dist z y) -> Metric_Space
completeness : forall E : R -> Prop, bound E -> (exists x : R, E x) -> {m : R | is_lub E m}
is_upper_bound = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => forall x : R, E x -> x <= m : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
OrderedRing.mk_SOR_theory : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> (forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 -> req (rplus x1 y1) (rplus x2 y2)) -> (forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 -> req (rtimes x1 y1) (rtimes x2 y2)) -> (forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> req (ropp x1) (ropp x2)) ->...-> OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt
Rbar_inv_opp : forall x : Rbar, x <> 0 -> Rbar_inv (Rbar_opp x) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_inv x)
VectorEq.eqb_eq : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), VectorEq.eqb A A_beq v1 v2 = true < -> v1 = v2
is_lb_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le l x : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_ub_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le x l : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_lub = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => is_upper_bound E m /\ (forall b : R, is_upper_bound E b -> m <= b) : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
VectorEq.eq_dec : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), {v1 = v2} + {v1 <> v2}
Rmin = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then x else y : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rmax = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then y else x : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Record ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_rt { Radd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; Radd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); Radd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); Rmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; Rmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); Rmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); Rdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd...
f_equal_R : forall (B : Type) (f : R -> B) (x y : R), x = y -> f x = f y
Rabs_Ropp : forall x : R, Rabs (- x) = Rabs x
Z.bi_induction : forall P : Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful Z.eq iff) P -> P 0%Z -> (forall x : Z, P x <-> P (Z.succ x)) -> forall z : Z, P z
bound = fun E : R -> Prop => exists m : R, is_upper_bound E m : (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
